Hi

the book shop at St pauls was called Books Nippon. I
went to to it last year to find it closed along with
all the shops in that row. they had riped the shops
out for reconstruction. They didnt have any relocation
details which was a shame. 

That shop was really cheap.

There was also the Japan centre near Soho, you would
sometimes pay almost double the yen price there. I
wont shop there now

Paul



--- "shogun.uk" <shogun.uk@...> wrote:

---------------------------------
Hi Rob

I get my Japanese Publications now direst from Japan.
There is a Japanese Amazon but frightning for non
Japanese readers!!
They must be well into the seventies now with their
"red series" but there are many more similar works of
interest... and as I always say ".. the pictures are
in English!!".

I have also obtained several of the volumes from the
Japanese Publications Centre - I am not upto date
regardng the location of it at present but there was a
shop near St Paul's Cathedral (the one in Warwick St
in central London closed) - There was also a large
shop inthe Japanese Retail outlet Centre (forgot the
name , sorry!!) on Edgware Road. I haven't looked on
the Net so there is that to try and also good old BT
Directory Enq..

Sorry have not been in touch... things have been more
than busy!!

                                Rod
  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: Rob Broom

  Sent: Wednesday, February 26, 2003 12:44 PM
  Subject: RE: [samuraihistory] Digest Number 449


  Any suggestions for getting hold of any of these
infamous Nihon Gunzo
  Rekishi or copies, or a loan, I have asked various
people but so far no
  luck.

  Any help appreciated.

  thanks and kind regards

  Rob
